Puranam (Eds) Handbook of Research on Organizational Transformations through Big Data Analytics, Book series: Advances in Business Information Systems and Analytics, IGI Global, Hershey PA, USA, 2015. Indexed in SCOPUS with the code 2-s2.0-84957066199

MEMBER of the EDITORIAL ADVISORY BOARD of the following volume: M. Tavana, A.H. Ghapanchi, A. Talaei-Khoei (Eds) Healthcare Informatics and Analytics: Emerging Issues and Trends, IGI Global, Hershey PA, USA, 2015. Indexed in SCOPUS with the code 2-s2.0-84959172824.

MEMBER of the EDITORIAL ADVISORY BOARD of the following volume: M. Tavana, K. Szabat, K. Puranam (Eds) Organizational Productivity and Performance Measurements Using Predictive Modeling and Analytics, Book series: Advances in Business Information Systems and Analytics, IGI Global, Hershey PA, USA, 2017.

MEMBER of the EDITORIAL ADVISORY BOARD of the Book Series: Advances in Business Information Systems and Analytics, IGI Global, Hershey PA, USA. https://www.igi-global.com/book-se ries/advances-business-information-syste ms-analytics/37155

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Speaker at the 39th Annual Meeting of the CANADIAN ECONOMIC ASSOCIATION MEETING. McMaster University, Canada. Talk Title: Bank runs without sunspots
Speaker at the SUMMER SCHOOL ON GAME THEORY AND ITS APPLICATIONS, Free University of Bozen-Bolzano, Italy, Talk Title: Bank runs without sunspots.
Speaker at the WEHIA 2006: FIRST INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ECONOMIC SCIENCES WITH HETEROGENEOUS INTERACTING AGENTS. University of Bologna, Italy. Talk Title: Banking with heterogeneous beliefs

Paper presented at the 21st ANNUAL CONGRESS of the EUROPEAN ECONOMIC ASSOCIATION. University of Vienna, Austria. Paper presented: Continuous Lexicographic Choice Through Incomplete Information. Presented by Debora Di Caprio (coauthor)

Project supervisor: Prof. Alfonso Bravo Juega (Universidad de Salamanca). Responsibilities: Analyzing case studies and data.

RESEARCH FELLOW at the Atkinson College, York University (Toronto, Canada). MCRI Project title: “Diaspora, Islam and Gender”. Project supervisor: Prof. Saeed Rahnema (York University). Responsibilities: performing the main statistical analysis.

RESEARCHER (external participant) at Free University of Bozen-Bolzano (Italy). Project: “Dynamical Regimes in Economics: modeling and statistical tools”. Project Supervisor: Prof. J.G. Brida. Responsibilities: research collaborations with the components of the research groups; producing results and articles for publication in international peer-reviewed journals and presentations at international conferences.
